basic_node.title: Specular/diffuse scattering by object parts
basic_node.description: Object parts scattering portions of beam. Reflectance expressed by Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF).
basic_node.references: [sp45, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8683075/] [sp45, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9127841/] [sp44, https://link.aps.org/doi/10.1103/PhysRevLett.126.174301] [sp44, https://www.fs.usda.gov/treesearch/pubs/30652] [sp55, https://doi.org/10.14372/IEMEK.2017.12.1.43] [di2, http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/5409636/, Reflection by perfectly mirroring surfaces leading to false positive detections behind the mirroring surface.] [di2, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-030-14757-0_5, Reflection by perfectly mirroring surfaces leading to false positive detections behind the mirroring surface. See p.61.] [di2, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8936913/, Reflection by perfectly mirroring surfaces leading to false positive detections behind the mirroring surface.] [re1, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/8500511/, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being scattered. Additionaly; direct reference is given here by Laser-Radar-Equation: Reflectivity of object K_r.] [re1, https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S0924271612000378, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being scattered. Additionaly diffuse scattering leading to distribution of scattering intensity (see BRDF).] [re1, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-319-12352-3_18, Mutual influence of absorption; reflection and transmission: A + R + T = 1 with absorption coefficient A; reflection coefficient R; transmission coefficient T. Thus; bigger portion of transmission and absorbtion of beam implies lower portion of beam being scattered. See p.415.] [re1, https://www.mdpi.com/1424-8220/20/11/3309, Diffuse scattering leading to distribution of scattering intensity (see BRDF).] [re1, https://www.osapublishing.org/abstract.cfm?URI=ao-54-30-8904, Diffuse scattering leading to distribution of scattering intensity (see BRDF).] [sp40, https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9127841/] [sp40, https://doi.org/10.14372/IEMEK.2017.12.1.43] [sp40, https://linkinghub.elsevier.com/retrieve/pii/S092427161630171X] [sp40, http://link.springer.com/10.1007/978-3-319-66787-4, p.448.] [re19, http://ascelibrary.org/doi/10.1061/%28ASCE%290733-9453%282005%29131%3A4%28135%29, See blooming.]
